item.title: 0-diffie_hellman_explained
item.description: Here I will explain the Diffie-Hellman algorithm and the discrete log problem! Diffie-Hellman In the algorithm first Alice generates ahead of time a prime number p and a generator g. Then when Bob starts a converstation with Alice, Alice generates a random value a, calculates A = pow(g, a, p), and then sends to Bob (g, p, A). Bob generates a random value b, calculates B = pow(g, b, p), and then sends it to Alice.

item.description: Challenge In this challenge we are an attacker sits between Alice and Bob and we perform “Man in the Middle” attack. We cannot change any parameter but the number of bytes chosen and support in the algorithm. Of course we will choose DH-64 bits, but how can we crack it?
